utility: New York State Electric & Gas Corporation (NYSEG)

CRITICAL_ASSESSMENT.reason: Smart Savings Rewards is exclusively a residential/small business smart thermostat program. This program is NOT suitable for battery energy storage optimization. NYSEG has SEPARATE programs for battery storage.

program_details.program_type: Residential/Small Business Smart Thermostat Demand Response
eligible_equipment: Smart thermostats (ecobee, Honeywell, Emerson Sensi, etc.)
Note: Google Nest Learning Thermostat 1st and 2nd gen not eligible after October 2025
program_details.enrollment_requirement: Must have or install eligible internet-connected smart thermostat controlling central air conditioning equipment

enrollment_bonus.standard_thermostat: $70 MasterCard e-gift card per eligible thermostat
enrollment_bonus.marketplace_purchase: $75 automatic rebate during purchase + $70 enrollment bonus
enrollment_bonus.notes: Only available for NEW program enrollments, not for replacing thermostats

seasonal_participation_credit.amount: $20 bill credit at end of season
seasonal_participation_credit.requirement: Must stay enrolled and participate in at least one thermostat adjustment without opting out

event_parameters.temperature_adjustment: Brief, limited thermostat temperature adjustments during peak demand
event_parameters.opt_out_penalty: Forfeits $20 seasonal credit if opted out of all events

BATTERY_STORAGE_ALTERNATIVES.note: Since Smart Savings Rewards is thermostat-only, battery storage customers should consider these NYSEG programs instead:

eligibility.location_requirement: Battery must be at same site as NYSEG electric service account
eligibility.enrollment: Apply via battery manufacturer's mobile app

payment_structure.formula: Average seasonal event performance × $50 per kW
payment_structure.calculation: Based on average power battery contributes to grid during critical periods

event_parameters.battery_discharge: Up to 80% of battery capacity per event

upfront_incentives.notes: Visit NYSERDA website to check eligibility

program_2_nyseg_commercial_system_relief.notes: For commercial/industrial battery storage providing load relief

eligibility.applies_to_battery: Yes, batteries providing load relief to grid

option_2_reservation.name: Reservation Payment Option
option_2_reservation.performance_payment: $0.50/kWh for load relief during test, planned and unplanned events

event_parameters.trigger: Day-ahead peak load forecast at least 92% of forecasted summer system-wide peak

scr_program.name: NYISO Special Case Resource (SCR)

payment_structure.capacity_payment: Variable $/kW-month based on monthly NYISO capacity auctions
payment_structure.capacity_formula: CAF (%) × Monthly clearing price × Site average performance factor
payment_structure.energy_payment: Additional payments for emergency dispatch events
payment_structure.payment_variability: Fluctuates monthly by zone based on auction results

historical_reference.projected_summer_2025_nyc: Potential increase of $10-11/kW-month due to capacity retirements
historical_reference.notes: Actual rates vary significantly by zone and auction results

participation_requirements.aggregation_required: Typically yes, through curtailment service provider
participation_requirements.stacking_limitations: Difficult to stack with distribution programs due to operational constraints

scr_program.2025_program_status: No changes to SCR program in 2025 (announced April 2025)

payment_structure.payment_basis: Actual load reductions in tests and events

participation.stacking: Can participate in one reliability-based (EDRP or SCR) and one economic-based program simultaneously
participation.constraints: Currently difficult to stack wholesale and distribution market participation

size_requirements.notes: 10 kW minimum is controversial and excludes most residential solar

nyseg_specific_requirements.aggregator_registration: Must complete NYISO registration before DER enrollment
nyseg_specific_requirements.transmission_node: All facilities must be on same transmission node
nyseg_specific_requirements.telemetry_setup: Required before enrollment, can take several months

program_4_vder_value_stack.program_name: Value of Distributed Energy Resources (VDER) Value Stack
program_4_vder_value_stack.established_by: New York State Public Service Commission

battery_participation.variability: Value Stack rate varies by when and where electricity is exported

stacking_restrictions.nyiso_participation: NYSEG removes energy/capacity compensation from Value Stack if receiving payment from NYISO
stacking_restrictions.export_to_nyiso: Customers exporting to NYISO ineligible for Phase One NEM or Buyback service
stacking_restrictions.note: Cannot double-dip on same value streams

tools.fact_sheets: Available from NYSERDA for storage-specific guidance

program_5_nyserda_upfront_incentives.program_name: NYSERDA Residential and Retail Energy Storage Incentives

retail_storage_incentives_2025.structure: Fixed-rate based on usable installed capacity (kWh AC)

retail_inclusive_storage_incentive.name: Retail ISI for Disadvantaged Communities
retail_inclusive_storage_incentive.eligibility: Projects at eligible critical facilities in DAC census tracts

residential_storage_incentives.notes: Available for residential battery installations, check NYSERDA website for current eligibility

stacking_with_performance_programs.note: NYSERDA upfront incentives can be combined with NYSEG performance-based DR payments and VDER compensation

NYISO_MARKET_CONTEXT.utility_role: NYSEG is NYISO member utility (Avangrid subsidiary)
NYISO_MARKET_CONTEXT.nyseg_service_territory: Central and eastern New York State
nyiso_zones_in_nyseg_territory: Note: NYSEG also serves parts of other zones

localities_with_higher_prices: Lower Hudson Valley (G-J Locality, Zones G-J)
capacity_market_structure.note: NYSEG territory is primarily 'Rest of State' with lower capacity prices than NYC

typical_capacity_clearing_prices.nyc_projected_2025: Potential increase of $10-11/kW-month due to capacity retirements
typical_capacity_clearing_prices.variability: Prices fluctuate significantly by zone, season, and market conditions

REGULATORY_CONTEXT.regulator: New York State Public Service Commission (PSC)

relevant_cases.case_15_e_0188: NYSEG Tariff filing for Dynamic Load Management Programs (demand response)
relevant_cases.case_18_e_0130: In the Matter of Energy Storage Deployment Program (statewide)

energy_storage_targets.nyserda_programs: Retail, Residential, and Bulk storage incentives to meet target
energy_storage_targets.policy_driver: Climate Leadership and Community Protection Act (CLCPA)

RECOMMENDED_PATHWAY_FOR_BATTERY_OPTIMIZA.recommendation: DO NOT pursue NYSEG Smart Savings Rewards for battery storage - it is thermostat-only

small_residential_under_25kwh.primary: NYSEG Energy Storage Solutions Program ($50/kW performance payment)
small_residential_under_25kwh.secondary: VDER Value Stack for export compensation
small_residential_under_25kwh.stacking: Can combine NYSERDA upfront + NYSEG performance + VDER

commercial_25kwh_to_5mw.primary: NYSEG Commercial System Relief Program (Reservation Option: $4.10-4.35/kW-month + $0.50/kWh)
commercial_25kwh_to_5mw.upfront: NYSERDA Retail Storage Incentive ($125-350/kWh depending on zone/DAC status)
commercial_25kwh_to_5mw.stacking: NYSERDA upfront + NYSEG CSRP + VDER possible, NYISO may preclude some NYSEG/VDER payments

large_commercial_over_5mw.primary: Direct NYISO participation (SCR capacity + EDRP energy)
large_commercial_over_5mw.notes: Over 5 MW typically participates directly in wholesale markets, limited distribution program eligibility

value_stacking_strategy.step_1: Secure NYSERDA upfront incentive ($200-400/kWh) to reduce capital cost
value_stacking_strategy.step_2: Enroll in NYSEG performance program (Energy Storage Solutions or CSRP) for capacity-based revenue
value_stacking_strategy.step_3: Participate in VDER for export compensation
value_stacking_strategy.step_4_optional: If ≥100 kW and willing to invest in telemetry/aggregation, pursue NYISO DER Aggregation for wholesale revenue
value_stacking_strategy.caution: NYISO participation may disqualify some NYSEG/VDER payments - verify stacking rules before committing
